content.label: Hi. I’ve been playing this game for a couple of years now. The music and animation is awesome. The events are great. There’s just one problem. The pull rates. I haven’t pulled a single five star adventurer in over 5 months! You’d think it’s just bad luck. If only. Turns out with a update they did a while back, they lowered the pull rates for 5 stars. Scummiest thing I ever heard. And they didn’t even say that they were changing it in the update notes. Now I’m hardly playing it because the game is no longer rewarding enough. Fix the pull rates man. Their crap.

Been playing on and off for 2 years now. Previously would have rated it 5 stars but after my phone died and I got a new one, I learned the hard way that the game doesn’t use your iCloud account or anything else to save your data. So unless you’ve previously gone through menus you’d never go through, your data is just lost.

Oh well. Probably for the best I stopped playing anyway. Was getting a little repetitive, Fienne still a 3-star character despite being the literal face of the game, and the new episodes are mainly just dialogue to draw out the play time. Or if you don’t devote hours a day to the game, you’re characters start getting seriously under powered. Not to mention you have better odds of winning the lottery than getting enough Chant scripts to upgrade more than one character a year.
Feels like a real rpg experience. It has some limitations, but it’s worth it for the story so far!
Sounds gets muted all the time

It has its slower moments, but when it connects and you spend some time, you’ll see how much charm this art-piece has, and the characters bring you nostalgia from games such as Chrono Trigger, one of the best RPGs of all time. This game has a lot of meat to it so go get lost in its multiverse of beautiful design. Updates get released a lot too so content is growing. It’s a must have game in my eyes.

I can’t remember how I found out about this game (I think it was a Facebook ad), and I was skeptical it was just going to be another waifu game with pretty pixel girls and no plot. I’ve never been happier to be wrong.

This is an outstanding game with good storytelling and a simple yet rich combat system. The best part is once you’re done with the story, there’s tons more content to play - all for free. This is not a pay-to-win game. All of the content is available to f2p players. Getting the stones (in-game currency) is fairly easy for dedicated players, and in two years of playing I haven’t bought any. As a f2p player, I still have multiple teams of 5-star characters. The best part? New content is added almost monthly (if not more often than that). The developers do a wonderful job providing additional content for the game regularly, and it is all free.

If you like Final Fantasy, Chrono Trigger or other games like those, download Another Eden right now. You won’t regret it.
Pretty good game. All around fun and the story was actually really good once you got to the 2nd world. all I can say is, “Aldo, I don’t know...”

title.label: More like a classic SNES RPG than a gacha game.

content.label: I am loving this game so far; it reminds me of Chrono Trigger more than anything, and that’s high praise.

This game desperately needs a skip button. Something that speeds up the story (or skips it entirely) and then gives a little summary. The dialogue is far too long and there are way too many story threads and quests for there to be no way to skip dialogue or even speed it up. I’m giving a one star in hopes that the developers will see and respond to this quickly. I’m closing the game out multiple times a day because I can’t be bothered to go through all that dialogue before being able to do anything.

When it been updated few days ago,  now we cannot battle Medusa in dogma tower cuz once you’re enter the room ..the app disconnected by itself,  rest of the quests worked perfectly but not dogma tower ..please fix it

This is a great game. Great characters and beautiful graphics. 
My only issue is with the excessively long dialogue sequences - sometimes 20 minutes or more of tapping through conversations.

So, I’ve been looking for some really good RPG games for awhile. I’m a big fan of Final Fantasy, Zelda and those major titles. I finally found a game worthy of this! The soundtrack is amazing and it gives me a beat that I can just beat to the rhythm to! The storyline is on point, the tutorial is not as annoying as it is in most games, and the drama is on key! This is a dream come true! This is one of those games that somehow slipped under the radar when it should have been on the radar in the first place!

title.label: Fairest of Free to Play Games

content.label: This is a FTP game with highish production values.  What is remarkable how the makers manage to prosper while avoiding the most explotative trophes of the genre while delivering such a high quality game to paying and nonpaying users alike.
Good game fun

title.label: Draw rates bad compared to japan.

content.label:
Like any other game released by Japanese company’s they don’t like global players always give them less gifts/rewards/draw rates. I read a factual article about another eden having false draw rates on global release. So most race hating country for video games? Going to make an article about this later. With japan treating global players bad with most games talk out of the way.

Another EDEN is a beautiful game. Story is well done and I enjoyed it. Sadly the new content coming out is getting harder without having key characters to beat the content. Only thing I wish is that 10 draw give 4.5 and not 3.5 as 4 stars. Only time I recommend spending money is when the pick a 5 star is out wish is really rare.

Update from close to the end of 2020:  game is boring and that’s a fact, draw rates where rigged in jp and japan players got 10k crystals for catching them scamming them. Global did not. Rates are kind of bad. Spent money on this about 80 dollars but feels like I only played 10 dollars worth. Jp gets bonus draws every so often global does not. 

Content release: they pushed back the region several times for global players because they didn’t want players to have a free 10 pull when it was released. Wish jp released games get banned from entering my country since 80% shaft global players treating them unequally. Very sad of japan.

Overall love the game. But spending $20 on a draw and getting nothing but low or repeat characters is a major drawback, especially when some side quests are borderline impossible without a strong enough team.

I love it it’s so much fun. I have sat and played for hours while listening to podcasts and music. You don’t have to be good at games to play or buy stuff to advance it’s really fair. I really enjoy it. :)

This has to be one of the best kept secrets in gaming. The only explanation is that it is a “mobile game” which are historically trash. I assumed this would be horrible based on micro transactions alone but decided to give it a go due to the writer and composer. Holy cow. 

Not only are the micro transactions in no way required if you are used to grinding in JRPGs, but they can *gasp* be genuinely helpful from time to time. 

Beyond that, this is more of a sequel to Chrono Trigger than Chrono Cross was. There are Easter eggs everywhere for die hard fans. I’ve been waiting years for this game, and it has been hiding in plain site on the friggin App Store of all places. I typically despise playing games on my phone, but I’m over 10 hours in with this one so far, and I’m just scratching the surface (I’ve also spent $0 to get this far). I plan on throwing some money at the developers just to support it, as others have mentioned, so don’t let the in-app purchases turn you away. This is an insane game to be giving away. If you play it, you’ll understand why we are all volunteering our money regardless.
I have an iPhone 11 and when ever I load the the game the sound cuts off. Still love the fame though just wish I had sound.

Probably the best game I’ve played since the ff7 days.  It does get a little grindy at times, but so much content, you can play for a year straight and still have more to do.  It’s easily f2p, no money grabs to keep playing.

title.label: Chrono Trigger, meet your new match

content.label: This is the game I have been searching for, for years. It has so many of my favorite game elements in it, drawing inspiration from classics like Chrono Trigger (about 75% similar!!), Star Ocean, a bit of Xenogears, Final Fantasy, and more. If you are a millennial gamer who has nostalgia for older games, fit for a modern mobile device, this is absolutely the game for you. There is no paywall to this game, nor any need to pay to proceed in the game storyline. No energy that runs out - it is, truly, an RPG with no limits to how far you can progress at once. That element alone makes the game binge-worthy, but even more importantly, this game has a great plot, inspired by the highlights of the the best games, and has a philosophical approach that wows me for how deep the meaning of the storyline goes, similar in a way to Final Fantasy 9’s approach to determining what makes a soul. I honestly love this game, and I’m so happy to have found it. It’s exactly what I was seeking, and it feels like a breath of fresh air.

Have been playing the game for years, now, highly recommend. 

Some issues persist. Still have as many 5* units as some ppl got in half a dozen good 10-pulls. 

Game NEEDS consecutive log-in bonuses which give some of the hardest to get mats; chant scripts, treasties, light/dark points, and desperately needs a pity. Have been farming mats to make one of my 4*’s into a 5 now for over a YEAR! 

This isn’t a new game, and may not hold up to the graphics quality of some newer games but still blows most everything in the market out of the water. 

If you haven’t played eden -you’re truly missing out!

title.label: Weird, great, flawed(?), perhaps even genius.

content.label:
I will try to limit this review mostly to those areas where I think the game could be significantly improved, whether in terms of functionality, or consistency (subquests mostly). This is a great game though, so if you are considering to play it, I would definitely recommend it. There are very few cohesive RPGs on the app store, and I would say this is one of them.

What do I mean when I say "cohesive"? Ara Fell, by Stegasoft is a great example of a mobile rpg done (mostly) right, and in a more traditional way, emulating a console experience in terms of fundamentals of gameplay. As far as concerns Another Eden, I would say that it is a good example of a more mobile, or "touch screen" focused mechanics done mostly well. An example of how badly that can go, I would say is found in the Romancing SaGa 2 port for iOS. I am partial to the more traditional format, as that's what I grew up with, and I prefer the experience of playing the game being more akin to playing my old gameboy, or PSP, or what have you. Nonetheless, while it took some getting used to, I have come to greatly enjoy this game.

The main issue with the game has to do with particulars of the system which lets you gain more party members, and with subquests. It's essentially the same issue. Basically, I've found two instances so far where I was able to gain access to a subquest that exposed me to part of the plot that hadn't been covered yet. (For the devs: specifically, the character subquests for Nero and Cyrus that are available in Ratle, and Aectuel respectively. I'm only at level 22, and so I'm sure there are other instances of this with other characters. If this is by design, then I think it represents something less than stellar. However, if it is merely an oversight, then I believe it should be rectified.)

Overall, I would recommend this game to anyone who is a serious RPG fan. There are some subtle nods, obvious to fans of Chrono Trigger, and plenty of other niceties beyond the games substance. The writing is so off the wall at times... varying from genuinely deep, and emotional (in the non-obligatory sidequests mostly), to horribly stereotypical and clichéd (I found myself face-palming a lot at times), and everywhere in between. It starts off feeling like it's not going to be all that much, and then little by little starts to sink in the enormity of scope of the plot. Some interesting crossovers as well at points. Of course... there is the hilarious oddity of this being yet another rpg where the first scene with the protagonist involves him being woken up by a sister/mother/childhood friend, and chided for his laziness. And the basic substance of the overarching plot is, yet again, man's offense against the natural world, dualistic philosophy (supernatural dark vs. light struggling for balance/dominance), the cliché modern slogan of: "we'll keep aiming for that better future" as the seeming moral of the story, and further evidence of the conflicting attitude the Japanese have toward their own heritage: simultaneously seeking to romanticize aspects of their past, such as the nobility of the samurai warrior, while also making commentary constantly about rejecting the encroachment of western values (e.g. christian ones), but then also taking the time to rail against aspects of their traditional identity that "don't fit" in the modern world. You'll see hints of this in the first sub plot when you go to the future for the first time. This game has left me guessing many times.
Very fun and interesting story
The best mobile game I’ve played in some time, no pay to play type of game, just a grind it out and level up
I keep downloading other games and this game downloads with them... every single time. Its like a parasite i cant get rid of. I keep deleting it and i can never get rid of it...

title.label: Fun game with no stamina restriction

content.label: I’ve been playing this game for a while and the no pity rate is really rough.  It’s hard for anyone to progress without any good characters.  The fact the game relies soo much on the gatcha characters really brings it down, especially if you do 6 tenfold a and get no 5 stars should be a crime.  My brother just quit playing this game for similar reasons.  I want to now quit as well.  This game needs to extend an olive branch especially to those who are having terrible luck.
Love this game have played it since release

So much of this is done right. The soundtrack is absolutely fantastic. So many times I stop just to listen. Backgrounds are beautifully rendered. So many times I stop to look. Battle is simple to understand but feels fresh and engaging.  Character progression is not overly complicated. No PVP to make me feel frustrated. I already beat it once and I’m going back to play again with a fresh file.
Very cool story just wish theres something related to multiplayer
I’m baffled, every fateful encounter (paid) I do always giving me the same character I’ve already had, even the rate up character is petty 10% and the 1% chance character show up, really ??

Although this game is good and is very story driven the fact that you lose everything you have is crazy five star characters another styles and then you have to start all over spending your money this game has been a waste of time as much as I like the game I do recommend it at all don’t waste your time and money it’s not worth it

title.label: Best single player on the market!

content.label:
I play a few games and my very first game ever was super Mario bro's/duck hunt. My first ever rpg was Breath of Fire SNES. Age 9 RPGs captivated me in a way no other genre could.

A perfection of the art; this game has it all and almost loses a star for the difficulty but it has difficulty spikes that fall away with a little practice and patience. I highly recommend putting a few dollars into the once a month specials. 

I haven't played for a few updates due to starting a family and my job beating me up a little but soon winter will be upon me and I can rejoin my friends in saving time from phantom!

title.label: Had a old acc and lost it

content.label: I had an old acc with felmina and days worth of progress but I lost it all and I can’t recover it back because 1. I don’t remember the transfer Id 2. I have no means of having a chance of getting anything toward that account since I was f2p  . I tried downloading on my phone that had the data stored on it but surprise! There’s no data :(

title.label: Super boring end game, no summon pity

content.label: End game is tedious and boring. Summoning doesn’t have a pity timer.

title.label: Looks like great game but it won’t load

content.label: So I downloaded the game and it did not load... now firstly, I’ve seen reviews recently about game so I know it works for some... maybe it’s cause I’m on an iPhone XS, but when I try to open it, it stays on loading screen for a while, then it ends up crashing... but, still, I’m gonna be hopeful that eventually it will work(hope devs will see this) and give it 4 stars, cause it looks fun

Gameplay is amazing as it actually requires skill and it can be p2w but is definitely not required and can be beaten without a penny

Mastapiece

There’s no dailies. No guilds to be kicked out of. It’s fun and entertaining full fledged rpg played on your phone. 

I love this unique game.
Thank you for this update!!! I have been waiting, and it worked! No more massively long “checking for updates “ screen!!! I am so happy to be able to play when I only have a couple minutes again!!! 😁
Super interesting and engaging. The character design is great and the music is incredible.

Seriously this game is very good 

The gacha is good 

In the beginning you can choose the character you want 

The problems are that in the beginning it’s takes too long to get in the game and get kicked out of the game time to time

From some of the minds behind the famous Chrono Trigger I should have known how amazing this game would be. But right from the start, the art style, music, gameplay, and story all immediately grabbed my attention. These elements all work together do beautifully, progressing through this game is as consuming a delicious cheesecake each wonderful bite at a  is a full scale JRPG that is essentilally free. You can thank the developers for this gift by rewarding yourself with some summoning if you want, but it is totally unnecessary. 
Give it a shot at the very least, it may be the hidden gem you’ve been looking for all along!

I was not expecting a free and amazing JRPG for the mobile. But here it is. I am so glad that I got a chance to play this game. It definitely filled that itch of playing JRPGs from the SNES and PS1 days. And unlike so many other “free” mobile games, you would never know that you needed to pay for extra characters because they do such a great job of giving you crystals every possible way. All the love to the team behind Another Eden. Also loved the various references to some of my favorite JRPGs like Chrono Trigger and Xenogears.
Cons: just a few such as buggy updates and the fact that the most recent updates made the load screen at the beginning take forever to finish. You also need to have some decent space/hardware to play this game since the updates keeps making the older phones obsolete.

Hi devs, 

I backed up my data today , and since it hasn’t stopped kicking out of the game as soon as I get past the « Continue » screen   Then I have to start over unsuccessfully.-pls help

Thanks

I’ve been hooked for the past three days, please do yourself a favor and download this wonderful game. I got a 5 star on my first pull, without investing anything. You could go the whole game without investing a dime! The amount of quests allow you to save and pull them hero’s.

title.label: Amazing and nostalgic nod to Chrono Trigger

content.label:
Great game in a style significantly similar to my all time favorite game Chrono Trigger.

Countless hours of uninterrupted game play and active creation of new content.

I highly recommend this game.
Lovin it

Gave this game more than a few chances to straighten out but it keeps crashing.   Contacted tech support and followed their TS steps.  It got worse and crashed at every turn.  Bottom line is I spent more time waiting for the game to load than actually playing.  Such a turn off and a shame.  Game is good and characters/story are great, when you can actually play the game.   Fix the crashing issue.   Make this priority 1 on the development team’s list.  Can’t money grab for crystals if tou can’t play the game!

This game is really fun and challenging. However I’m not to happy getting kicked out when I’m about to complete a quest. For some ridiculous reason the game kicks me off at the worst time. If anyone can tell me why I’d appreciate it. Other than that I thoroughly enjoy this game.
